channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: FBI surges resources to Minnesota as Director Patel calls $250M fraud scheme 'tip of a very large iceberg'
item.description: FBI surges resources to Minnesota as investigation into $250 million Feeding Our Future fraud scheme continues.

item.title: 'I never questioned, 'Why me?'': Erika Kirk says 'God is good' months after husband's assassination
item.description: Charlie Kirk's widow says she has a simple explanation for people who still can't understand how she's able to forgive the man accused of killing her ...

item.title: ‘Godfather of AI’ Geoffrey Hinton predicts 2026 will see the technology get even better and gain the ability to ‘replace many other jobs’
item.description: "It's already extremely good. We're going to see it having the capabilities to replace many, many jobs."

item.title: The Cookies of Christmas Past and Present
item.description: My plan: to make ten recipes over the course of a week.

item.title: The retirement of this notoriously finicky card marks the end of an era for one of the world’s oldest and largest transit systems
item.description: The last day to buy or refill a MetroCard is Dec. 31, 2025, as the transit system fully transitions to OMNY, a contactless payment system.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi predicts Democrats will win the House and Hakeem Jeffries will become speaker

item.title: Bank of America’s Moynihan sees Trump’s tariffs starting to de-escalate
item.description: “To go from a 10% across-the-board to 15% for the broad base of countries — not a huge impact,” Moynihan said.

item.title: Bring Back Snow Days
item.description: A day of sledding, snowmen, and sleeping in offers more benefits than drawbacks.

item.title: California tech founders unload on a proposed state wealth tax that already has some billionaires preparing an escape. ‘I am screwed for life’
item.description: "One market correction, nationalization event, or prohibition of divestiture (not at all uncommon during wartime) and I am screwed for life."

item.title: France’s Populist Surge Is a Cautionary Tale for America’s Right
item.description: Populism can win elections, but without fiscal discipline, it risks perpetuating the very welfare bloat it rails against.

item.title: ‘We are not afraid’: Erika Kirk vows TPUSA will continue campus debates nationwide
item.description: Erika Kirk tells Fox News that Turning Point USA will resume college presence after her husband Charlie Kirk's tragic death during Utah campus event.

item.description: President Trump touted his tariffs and crime rates as his first year back in office comes to a close.

item.title: New York Legalizes Doctors Prescribing Death
item.description: New York Gov. Hochul announced last week that she will sign a bill legalizing medically assisted suicide for adults with a terminal illness.
